page.title: 05THE RIVER TEES
page.content: The bend in the River Tees where it skirts Bassleton Woods is a good example of a meander.At the time of our survey the tide was out and the flow rate was 50 metres per minute. There was evidence of earlier heavy rain upriver as the river appeared swollen with much debris being carried downriver such as tree trunks,grass, branches and other flotsam.It was also noticed that there was little human rubbish_no cartons,paper etc..We also observed that it is almost certain this particular section would in time develop into an ox_bow lake as the shape is already a well established horse_shoe.The destruction of the trees,by erosion,on the east bank is progressing at a fast pace while on the west bank the erosion is causing soil slip on the higher cliff.There was no indication of pollution.
